title: Solution To The Mage Support Issue!
body:
Quite simple, make it so instead of gaining gold after damaging an enemy with FQC/STE, make it so you get gold after speeding up/healing/shielding an ally,
something like Max of 3 charges, gain a charge every 10 seconds, gain 15 gold after using a charge (charges expend after using speedups/heals/shields on allies) with the cd reducing and gold increasing after every upgrade from spell thiefs edge

This would make sure there wouldnt e anymore of these annoying ''mage supports'' that get 1 item (FQC) and get full dmg, provide 0 utility, and sit there for the sole purpose of damage, it would also reduce damage creep and increase incentive to pick legitimate supports that actually support their team

The way I see it her kit(q and ult specifically) were not designed for the game to be as mobile as it is now, the more reliable aspects of her kit have been consistently buffed for a while, but I'm not sure what the point of that is.

> If you don't to believe me, that's okay but don't assume anything. I have nothing to win here, I'm just telling my point of view.

Thing is you won't last long here unless you sumbit to the winrate gods, they don't like your kind around here.

you don't see him picked into lulu or karma much either, do you?
he is _slightly_ out of meta, minor numbers changes or possible an indirect buff will cause him to be a contested pick again.

> I hope so.

I mean, tank supports dominated competitive EXTREMELY hard for ages, so you won't see me complain about them being slightly out of meta for a relatively short time(they basically owned bot lane since the start of season 4 until near the end of season 6 if I'm not mistaken).

>That would be like if fighters would have as much as burst assasins, or if tanks would do as much damage as juggernauts: they would overshadow the purpose of a class while also keeping theirs.

I'm sorry but I fail to find shields, heals and reliable instant CC (except for Malz's ult) in their kits, so no they are not comparable to tanks having juggernaut CC in the slightest, if anything {{champion:99}} is maybe the closest comparsion to that ecause she has a shield.

> [{quoted}](name=Sexy Bisex Plant,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEUvgbMV,comment-id=0004000000010000000000000001,timestamp=2017-03-13T05:13:31.988+0000)
>
> I'm sorry but I fail to find shields, heals and reliable instant CC (except for Malz's ult) in their kits, so no they are not comparable to tanks having juggernaut CC in the slightest, if anything {{champion:99}} is maybe the closest comparsion to that ecause she has a shield.

You don't need shields or heals to be a support, {{champion:26}} is a good example. The thing is that you really need to have to be a viable in the support role is to, sadly, have CC. Anything else is secondary and will only matter in the playstyle of the champion. But the only thing that all supports **don't have** is damage. Yes, some just do a little bit more dmg than others early game like {{champion:26}} q's for example. But the thing is that late game, his dmg falls off really hard and his double q will be use to stun. In fact, he doesn't have a passif once everyone on his team is level 18. But ap ''supports''? Their dmg doesn't fall up, because they were designed like mages which means it only gets better with items but because they also have CC, this is where everything starts to go wrong. Before the mage update, they were a little bit like Zilean: they were early game mages bullies except that unlike old zilean, they had cc. However, their early game was weak because they were items dependent like most mages at the time.

But of course, everything changed when the mage update attacked.

No you don't need Shields and Heals to be a support, I'm reffering to the claim that mages just overshadow supports (Enchanters, to be correct) in all aspects as much as if tanks had juggernaut damage, they'd overshadow them, which is simply **bullshit**, because:

#Tanks 
* Tankiness
* CC
 
#Juggernauts
* Tankiness
* Damage

#Tank + Juggernaut
* Tankiness
* CC
* Damage

That would be an outclass.

#Supports
* CC
* Shields/Heals

#Mages
* CC
* Damage

#Support + Mage (which you compared to Tank + Juggernaut)
* CC
* Damage

Ok, I understand the sentiment but there's some problems with it I'd like to discuss:

Firstly, Frost queen encourages engaged gameplay.  The fact that you actually have to fight the opponent to gain gold is much healthier and interesting than giving gold for every time you heal while sitting back under tower. I think the REAL PROBLEM with Frost queen's claim is that you can trigger it multiple times with one DOT ability.  You should get one proc per spell, such that you must work hard to earn that gold. Whether there should be mages or not in bot is not a problem with Frost Queen's claim itself.

That said, I think there is merit to your idea.  It would be interesting if utility supports were encouraged to use their heals and shields in engaging ways rather than turtling.  For example,what if you gained gold every time a shield you applied took damage? It would have the same "turns off if you CS" effect as frost queen, but encourages you to work with your carry to actively engage and gain gold.  And if you are behind and getting bullied, you will still find plenty of chances to gain gold.  It could work similarly for healing.  If you heal an ally and they take damage again within 5 seconds, or if you heal an ally below 50% hp you would gain gold.

With regards to mages in bot lane, either heal supports need to become more popular (they counter the mage poke tactics) or if that isn't enough then tank supports need a cheap item that builds out of spectral cowl.
